name: Pastor Bobby Bullard
description: Pastor Bobby Bullard was born in Monroe Louisiana to Pastor Solomon James Bullard Sr. and Beatrice Bullard on June 29, 1961. He was the 8th child of 8 children. Pastor Bullard graduated from Walter L. Cohen High School in New Orleans La. in 1979. He then attended Claflin College on a basketball and Music scholarship. The next year he transferred to Allen University on a basketball and music scholarship. He majored in Voice. After the untimely death of his father in July 1983 he left school and later joined the Army where he served 10 Â½ years in the United States Army. After getting out of the Army, he relocated to Austin Texas in November 1993. Later he joined Mount Sinai Missionary Baptist Church under the leadership of Pastor A. W. Anthony Mays. In November 1994 at the 7:45am service he accepted his call to The Gospel Ministry. He served under Pastor Mays for 13 years until he was called to pastor St. Phillips Missionary Baptist Church, Rosanky Texas, which later moved to Austin Texas as it's primary location. Pastor Bullard has three boys (Bobby T, Isaiah, and Isaac) and 3 granddaughters. Pastor Bullard's favorite opening statement is, TO GOD BE THE GLORY, FOR THE THINGS THAT HE HAS DONE. GOD IS A GOOD GOD, HE IS A GREAT GOD, AND HE CAN DO ANYTHING BUT FAIL!!!!!!
